problems.title: Hamming Distance (Bit Manipulation)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

The Hamming distance between two integers is the number of positions at which the corresponding bits are different.
Given two integers x and y, return the Hamming distance between them.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
1 4

Sample Output
2

Explanation:
1   (0 0 0 1)
4   (0 1 0 0)
       ↑   ↑
The above arrows point to positions where the corresponding bits are different.

Sample Input
3 1

Sample Output
1

Explanation: 3 (0011) and 1 (0001) differ at 1 position.
hintsList: XOR x and y, then count the number of set bits in the result.
Use bit manipulation: (x ^ y) and count bits using n & (n-1) trick.
